nodes.text: The mother of the Twi'lek farmer Jac Lodain was a female individual who settled on the Outer Rim planet Batuu with Lodain's father at some point after their son Jac was born around 18 ABY. The father took Jac and his mother to Batuu after he fought against the Galactic Empire alongside Lodain's aunt and lost his arm.

During the smuggler Izal Garsea's visit to Batuu around 34 ABY, Lodain mentioned his mother noticing a Resistance presence around Batuu's ancient ruins at some point after the Hosnian Cataclysm. However, the father had entreated her to keep the discovery quiet because of the First Order's stormtroopers deployed on the planet.
Jac Lodain's mother was first mentioned in A Crash of Fate, a 2019 young-adult novel written by Zoraida Córdova.
